intro: Ivesia longibracteata, commonly known as the long-bract ivesia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other related plants. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and lance-shaped, with a hairy texture. Ivesia longibracteata thrives in rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments.
